component.text: The purpose of this tour is to:

• Give an overview of the new Graphical User Interface
  • Highlight some new features
  • Point out some features that are built, but not useable in the current test
The course and curriculum are named in the top-right area.
The top-left area indicates your location in the course.
Pages within a topic have numbers, but no names. The green circle indicates the current page.

The detailed location box combines all the location information provided at the top of the screen using a chapter.section.topic.page notation.

You can type a location you wish to jump-to in the location box.
Then, click on the jump-to icon to jump to the specified page.

The Section Status/Navigation bar displays segments to represent each section in the chapter. Your current location within the chapter is highlighted in green. Placing the cursor over a section displays the title of that section.

You may click on any section of that chapter to quickly jump to that section.
Introduction and summary sections are indicated in yellow. The dark blue section at the end indicates a quiz.
The Next and Back buttons take you to the next or previous page.
The lower-left portion of the interface contains functions for index, search, glossary and tools.
The translation button allows immediate text toggle to another language, if available. No second language is available before the English version.
If there is text on a page, it is displayed on the left side.
A scroll bar will appear if there is text that cannot be seen.
